articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to General Machinery Plant
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to General Machinery Plant
Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the technologically updated January 18 General Machinery Plant.
					 He went round the inside and outside of the plant to learn in detail about its technological updating and production there.
					
					 The workers of the plant have finished the work for its modernization and scientification based on the latest technology by their own efforts and wisdom and energetically developed new technologies to bring about a radical change in production.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il expressed great satisfaction over this success, watching the production processes equipped with home-made CNC-based machines and new machinery.
					
					 The plant has undergone radical changes to meet the need of the knowledge-based economy era thanks to the brisk mass technical innovation movement conducted by its officials, workers and technicians true to the Party's policy of attaching importance to science and technology, he said, adding: This signal advance is a display of the great mental power of the heroic Korean workers who have always won victories through progress and innovation.
					
					 He also made the rounds of newly-built canteen and other cultural and welfare facilities for the workers to acquaint himself with the cultural life and supply service at the plant.
					
					 Seeing neat and clean dining room, kitchen, bean store and processing room, he noted that the plant has made signal changes in the supply service in a few years through its careful arrangement and redoubled efforts with the proper viewpoint on the workers. And he expressed great satisfaction over the provision of good living conditions to the workers.
					
					 The plant has an important role to play in the development of the nation's machine building industry, he said, advancing the tasks for it. 
					
					 Its most important task is to keep the production of machinery going at a high rate and produce more new-type efficient machinery, he said. He set the goal for the plant to hit in the near future and indicated orientation and ways to do it.  
					
					 The officials of the plant should energetically guide the masses as the supporter and implementer of the Party's policies and the fighter standing in the van of the drive to devotedly carry out the tasks set forth by the Party, he urged.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and conviction that the workers of the plant would creditably perform their role as the vanguard and shock brigade in implementing the WPK's economic policy.
					
					 Accompanying him were Hong In Bom, chief secretary of the South Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Pak To Chun, Thae Jong Su and Kim Phyong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, and Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Co-op Farms Alive with Preparations for This Year's Farming
articles.content:
Co-op Farms Alive with Preparations for This Year's Farming
Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The cooperative farms in the DPRK are busy with preparations for this year's farming.
					 The joint New Year editorial set the agricultural front as a lifeline for improving the standard of people's living. The agricultural workers are pushing ahead with those preparations faster than last year in hearty response to it. 
					
					 Co-op farms in Sunan and Ryongsong Districts and other areas of Pyongyang singled it out as one of the important ways for attaining their high goals to increase the fertility of paddy and non-paddy fields and are now channeling their efforts into the drive to do so.
					
					 The farmers in South Hwanghae Province are focusing their efforts on the production of quality organic fertilizer and its transport to the fields.
					
					 The province plays an important role in the nation's agricultural development. 
					
					 The farmers of North Hamgyong Province are carrying thousands of tons of manure to paddy and non-paddy fields every day despite unfavorable weather conditions by mobilizing all manpower and means of transport available under detailed plans. 
					
					 Those in South and North Phyongan Provinces and other areas are taking good care of high-yield seeds suited to the topographical and soil conditions already prepared for sowing. 
					
					 Signal successes are being also made in the production of compost and bio-fertilizers. 
					
					 The repair and maintenance of farm machines and implements are making brisk headway on co-op farms across the country to make this year's farming successful. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a high-pitched drive is now under way at the tractor spare parts plants to provide the farms with a sufficient number of parts. Co-op farms are provided with huge quantities of compost and farm implements by employees of the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions and those in various provinces, cities and counties.

articles.title: County Widely Known for Rapid Progress of Local Industry
articles.content:
County Widely Known for Rapid Progress of Local Industry 
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) --There is an icon of local industry in the DPRK. This is Changsong County, North Phyongan Province.
					 95 percent of its area is covered with mountains. 
					
					 In the past the people in this remote area had lived, cultivating patches of mountain land, far removed from modern civilization. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung learnt in detail about the reality of the county and living conditions of its people and clearly indicated the orientation and ways for the county to follow. 
					
					 Under his wise leadership all the resources in the mountains, once regarded as useless, were fully tapped for the wellbeing of the population of the county. 
					
					 Its people increased income by picking wild fruits and edible herbs and developed local industry by use of raw materials available from the mountains. 
					
					 Their demands for processed foodstuff, cloth, wooden products, paper, etc. are met with county's products. 
					
					 They led a stable life thanks to the self-supporting economy foundation of the county even during the Arduous March, the forced march, without depending on the state. 
					
					 Local industrial factories in Changsong County registered a signal boost in production in recent years by putting their production processes on a modern and scientific basis and taking thorough measures for providing raw materials to them.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the county last year and praised it for its achievements. There he kindled a torch of a local industrial revolution.
					
					 The provinces, cities and counties are now channeling efforts into the drive to develop local industry following the example set by Changsong County.

articles.title: Shining Path Covered by Korean Youth Movement
articles.content:
Shining Path Covered by Korean Youth Movement
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- January 17 marked the anniversary of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					 The Korean youth movement has covered a glorious path, making steady progress thanks to the peerlessly great persons' idea of attaching importance to the youth.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung formed the Young Communist League of Korea on August 28, 1927 with core members of the Down-with-Imperialism Union involving young people of different strata.
					
					 Young revolutionaries became the backbone of the ranks of anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters under his care and creditably performed a vanguard role in crushing the Japanese imperialists and achieving the historic cause of national liberation.
					
					 The Democratic Youth League was founded on January 17, 1946 after liberation of Korea on the basis of the successes and experience gained in the Korean youth movement during the anti-Japanese armed struggle. Later it developed into the League of Socialist Working Youth of Korea as required by the developing revolution.
					
					 In the period of building a new country young people rendered patriotic services in rural areas and factories while playing a vanguard role in such nature-remaking projects as the Pothong River Improvement Project.
					
					 During the Fatherland Liberation War they rushed to the front and bravely fought for the Workers' Party of Korea and the leader, the country and people. In the postwar period of rehabilitation and construction and the period of the grand Chollima march they performed miracles and innovations in each construction site, making a breakthrough towards leaping advances.
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the LSWYK was renamed the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, a prestigious youth organization going by the august name of the President. 
					
					 It was thanks to his profound trust and loving care that they built such gigantic structures as Youth Hero Motorway, the Kwangmyongsong Saltern and large power stations during the Arduous March, the forced march.
					
					 They are performing feats at the posts defending the country and in the difficult and labor-consuming work sites for making a breakthrough towards the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: US Nuclear Carrier Fleet's Entry into Northeast Asia Blasted
articles.content:
US Nuclear Carrier Fleet's Entry into Northeast Asia Blasted
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A fleet of the U.S. nuclear-powered carrier Carl Vinson moved to the Northeast Asian region, away from its main duty to defend the U.S. mainland, said Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a by-lined commentary. 
					 This dangerous development followed the recent junket of the U.S. Defense secretary to south Korea and Japan where he discussed "tightening alliance" and "boosting military cooperation", according to the commentary.
					
					 This reveals the U.S. stand and strategic attempt to escalate military pressure and blackmail against the DPRK and ignite a war against it any moment, the news analyst said, adding:
					
					 The U.S. responded to the DPRK's magnanimous and goodwill proposal for dialogue with introduction of the fleet in war exercises in waters off the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The world is warmly supporting the proposal as realistic and practical one, hoping the military conflict and confrontation that may lead the peninsula to a war be ceased and peace and stability settle.
					
					 If the U.S. has the will to set right the abnormal situation on the Korean Peninsula, it should face up to the reality with reason and stop going against the trend of the times and mindset of people.
					
					 The U.S. acts quite contrary to its words like "peace" and "security".
					
					 It is answering the desire of the world peace-loving people for dialogue and peaceful atmosphere in the peninsula with war exercises.
					
					 Its stand and attitude toward the dialogue would serve as a touchstone showing whether it wishes peace in Northeast Asia and denuclearization on the peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Carry out Inter-Korean Declarations
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Carry out Inter-Korean Declarations
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- To carry out the inter-Korean declarations is the basic way for ending the confrontation between the north and the south under the present situation, according to a bylined article of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday. 
					 The north and the south have sufficient preconditions for reaping good fruit from dialogue and negotiations, said the article, adding:
					
					 The historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration for implementing it are supported by all Koreans. 
					
					 They helped the north and the south convert the relations of distrust and confrontation into those of "By our nation itself" based on reconciliation and unity and usher in a new era of independent reunification, peace and prosperity. 
					
					 Witnessing progress made under the banner of the inter-Korean declarations all Koreans at home and abroad renewed the faith that the prosperity of a reunified country would surely come if they pool their efforts in the spirit of "By our nation itself." 
					
					 The Korean people keenly realized the value of the inter-Korean declarations and the need for implementing them during the past three years, in particular. Their implementation would provide a realistic way for saving the Korean nation and holding successful dialogue and negotiations. 
					
					 Only when the south Korean authorities repeal the confrontation policy and honestly implement the inter-Korean declarations is it possible to reap good fruit from dialogue and negotiations, mend the north-south relations and ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Minju Joson on Japan's Ambition for Overseas Aggression
articles.content:
Minju Joson on Japan's Ambition for Overseas Aggression
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Recently Japan had confabs for strengthened military cooperation with the U.S., asserting the "need" to tighten the "security alliance" with it to cope with "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula and its vicinity.
					 Minju Joson, a major newspaper of the DPRK, disclosed this fact in a bylined commentary Tuesday.
					
					 The commentary said:
					
					 The Japan Defense Ministry decided to transfer the Missile Defense Command to the U.S. military base in Yokota within the year as a step for speeding up the establishment of missile defense system. It also decided to deploy land-based interceptor missiles in Okinawa, first of its kind.
					
					 Such militarist hysteria of Japan poses a serious threat to peace and security in Northeast Asia.
					
					 Japan's talk about "threat" from someone is sophism to justify its scheme for overseas expansion, an invariable design and strategic goal of Japan.
					
					 In recent years, the Japanese reactionaries' moves for overseas aggression have reached an extreme pitch.
					
					 Their scheme to boost military cooperation with the U.S. is a revelation of the Japanese militarist forces' dangerous war scenario aimed at reinvasion of not only Korea and China but also other Asian countries.
					
					 Japan is no longer a "pacifist state."
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should squarely see the present era going toward peace and stop at once the anachronistic moves for reinvasion, which will precipitate their own destruction.

articles.title: US Urged to Roll back Its Anti-DPRK Policy
articles.content:
US Urged to Roll back Its Anti-DPRK Policy
Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A south Korean organization demanded the U.S. withdraw its anti-DPRK policy. 
					 The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in a news conference in Seoul on Jan. 14 accused the U.S. defense secretary of trying to let south Korea take part in the U.S.-led missile shield for alleged "cooperation".
					
					 He visited Seoul at a time when remarks hostile to the DPRK are heard from those for the U.S. diplomacy and security, said the organization. 
					
					 The U.S. policy for military pressure on the DPRK rather than dialogue and negotiations will result in escalating tensions on the Korean Peninsula, it said. 
					
					 It urged the U.S. to unconditionally come out to the negotiating table for peace agreement.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Accept DPRK's Proposal
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Accept DPRK's Proposal
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Party of Romania issued a statement on Jan. 12 in support of the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 Dialogue and negotiations are the only way for defusing the tension of the Korean Peninsula and averting the danger of a war, the statement said. 
					
					 The important proposal made in the joint statement fully reflects the desire of all Koreans to lead an independent and peaceful life as a homogenous nation, it said, adding:
					
					 We support the DPRK's efforts to thaw the present tension in a peaceful way through dialogue and negotiations and urge the south Korean authorities to respond to its reasonable proposal without delay.

articles.title: DPRK Proposal Supported in Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
DPRK Proposal Supported in Equatorial Guinea
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Juan Nko Mbula, deputy general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, issued a statement on Jan. 11 to support the joint New Year editorial and the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK. 
					 Extending warm congratulations to the Workers' Party and people of Korea on the New Year, 2011, the statement said:
					
					 In the joint New Year editorial of major newspapers the DPRK set forth the tasks for national reunification. And it proposed, through the joint statement, to have dialogue and negotiations at all levels between the north and the south in order to tide over the difficulties prevailing on the Korean Peninsula.  
					
					 I am sure that this stand of the WPK and the DPRK government will play a positive role in achieving peace and reunification of the peninsula and national reconciliation.

articles.title: French Social Body Hails DPRK Joint Statement
articles.content:
French Social Body Hails DPRK Joint Statement
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association supported the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK in a statement on Jan. 11. 
					 The joint statement reflects the will of the Korean people to mend the north-south relations at an early date, promote the national reconciliation and unity and achieve the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula, said the statement.
					
					 The organization noted it would more dynamically wage the international solidarity movement for the conclusion of the DPRK-U.S. peace agreement.

articles.title: Nigerian Pressman Hails DPRK's New Year Editorial and Proposal
articles.content:
Nigerian Pressman Hails DPRK's New Year Editorial and Proposal 
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian pressman supported the joint New Year editorial and the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 A deputy editor of The New Nigerian in a statement on Jan. 10 supported the editorial which calls for defusing the confrontation, removing the potential danger of a war and advancing dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south.
					
					 Just is the struggle of the Korean people to foil outsiders' move to ignite a new war on the Korean Peninsula, he said.
					
					 Progressive mankind is expressing solidarity with the Koreans for national reunification. Another decade of the 21st century will be a decade of reunification for all the Koreans, he added.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should halt its treacherous and anti-reunification actions and opt for genuine peace and reunification, he urged.

articles.title: US, S. Korea Urged to Drop Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
US, S. Korea Urged to Drop Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- An organization of Finland demanded that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities drop at once their hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 The Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea made this demand in its statement on Jan. 11 supporting the joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations. 
					
					The joint statement of the DPRK clearly showed the ardent love for the nation and the will for reunification of General Secretary Kim Jong Il carrying into brilliant reality President Kim Il Sung's behests for national reunification, the statement said.
					
					 It is needed to solve through contacts and consultation all the problems existing between the north and the south in order to defuse the present tension of the Korean Peninsula and achieve its independent and peaceful reunification, it stressed.

articles.title: Danes Hope for Improved North-South Relations
articles.content:
Danes Hope for Improved North-South Relations
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association issued a statement on Jan. 11, demanding halt to any action obstructive to the improved north-south relations.
					 The Association hoped that the north and the south would sit together to seek a negotiated, peaceful solution to the problems for easing the tension prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and averting the danger of a war without outsiders' interference.
					
					 It called upon the government, political parties and organizations of Denmark to extend support and solidarity to the proposal of the DPRK for dialogue and negotiations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige el Combinado de Maquinaria 18 de Enero
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige el Combinado de Maquinaria 18 de Enero 
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno el Combinado de Maquinaria 18 de Enero modernizado con nuevas tecnologias.
					Recorrio primero el interior y el exterior de esa fabrica cerciorandose del estado de renovacion tecnica y produccion. 
					
					Al ver los procesos productivos dotados de muy eficientes maquinas CNC hechas en Corea y los nuevos productos mecanicos, se mostro muy satisfecho de que los obreros del combinado hayan registrado un cambio trascendental en la produccion al realizar por cuenta propia y a base de tecnologias sofisticadas la modernizacion y la cientifizacion y desarrollar nuevas tecnologias.
					
					Los funcionarios, los obreros y los tecnicos de la fabrica libraron dinamicamente el movimiento masivo de innovacion tecnica, en pleno acato a la idea del Partido de dar importancia a la ciencia y tecnica, y pudieron transformar asi su fabrica a la altura de la era de economia basada en la intelectualidad, dijo.
					
					Prosiguio que tal avance vertiginoso es una muestra de la gran fuerza espiritual de nuestra heroica clase obrera que siempre sale victoriosa con el progreso e innovaciones. 
					
					Acto seguido, hizo conocimiento de la vida cultural y de autoabastecimiento recorriendo los establecimientos correspondientes como el recien construido comedor de obreros. 
					
					Al pasar revista al comedor limpio y comodo, la cocina, el deposito de soya y la sala de procesamiento, se puso muy contento de las magnificas condiciones de vida para los obreros, diciendo que esta fabrica ha alcanzado relevantes cambios en unos anos al realizar ingentes esfuerzos por mejorar la labor de autoabastecimiento con el correcto punto de vista de los obreros. 
					
					  Senalando que esta fabrica desempena un papel importante para el desarrollo de la industria de maquinaria del pais, presento las tareas a cumplir por ella.
					
					  La tarea mas importante es normalizar en el alto nivel la produccion de maquinas y fabricar mayor cantidad de maquinas eficientes de nuevo tipo, senalo y definio la meta a alcanzar por la fabrica en un futuro cercano e ilumino el rumbo y remedios para el particular.
					
					  Los funcionarios de aqui deben dirigir bien a las masas trabajadoras siendo ejecutores que apoyen las politicas del partido no con palabras sino con acciones para ponerlas en practica y cumplan en la delantera y a costa de vida las tareas asignadas por el partido.
					
					  Expreso la gran esperanza y conviccion de que la clase obrera de la fabrica cumplira magnificamente el papel de vanguardia en la materializacion de la politica economica del partido.
					
					  Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Hong In Bom, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak To Chun, Thae Jong Su y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, y Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia belicismo de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia belicismo de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ATCC) -- El secretario de Defensa de Estado Unidos sostuvo hace poco debates sospechosos en el Sur de Corea y Japon pretextando el "fortalecimiento de alianza" y la "promocion de cooperacion militar". Coincidiendo con eso, la flotilla del portaaviones estadounidense "Carl Vinson", cuya mision principal es defender el territorio norteamericano, se traslado a la region del Nordeste Asiatico atravesando el oceano. 
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual de este martes, lo califica de acontecimiento peligroso que refleja la posicion e intencion estrategica de EE.UU. de intensificar la presion y chantaje sobre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y desatar sorpresivamente la guerra de agresion contra esta.
					
					En una palabra, EE.UU. responde con el garrote a la propuesta magnanima y benevola de la RPDC de reiniciar el dialogo, destaca el comentarista y continua:
					
					Ahora todo el mundo aplaude y apoya la iniciativa realista y pragmatica de la RPDC deseando que se ponga fin a los conflictos armados y la confrontacion, que pueden provocar la guerra en la Peninsula Coreana, y lleguen la paz y la estabilidad en esta region.
					
					Si EE.UU. tiene la voluntad de reparar la situacion anormal de esa peninsula, debe ver con serenidad la realidad y atenerse a la tendencia de la epoca y a la opinion publica. 
					
					EE.UU. suele hablar de la "paz" y "seguridad", pero actua por el contrario. 
					
					Lo comprueba la flotilla del portaaviones estadounidense que realiza freneticamente la maniobra belica en las aguas maritimas de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					El belicismo de EE.UU. ofende la buena fe de los pueblos del mundo amantes de la paz que demandan el clima de dialogo y paz en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					La posicion y actitud sobre el dialogo son la pauta que determina si EE.UU. desea o no la paz del Nordeste Asiatico y la desnuclearizacion de toda la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun exige implementar declaraciones conjuntas N-S
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun exige implementar declaraciones conjuntas N-S
						
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ATCC) -- Bajo la situacion actual, el remedio principal para levantar la cortina de enfrentamiento entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea esta en ejecutar la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, programa para poner en practica la primera.
					  Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este martes y continua:
					
					  Entre ambas partes de Corea ya se han dado las condiciones para el dialogo y negociaciones fructiferos. Esas condiciones son precisamente las declaraciones arriba mencionadas que cuentan con el apoyo de toda la nacion.
					
					  Gracias a la publicacion de ellas, se pudieron convertir las relaciones de desconfianza y confrontacion en las de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales" que promueven la reconciliacion y la unidad y abrir la nueva epoca de reunificacion independiente, paz y prosperidad.
					
					  En aquellos dias orgullosos en que todos los coreanos del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar avanzaban bajo la bandera de la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur, ellos llegaron a tener la conviccion de que se lograran sin falta la reunificacion y la prosperidad, si los connacionales unen el alma y las fuerzas.
					
					  En particular, durante los ultimos 3 anos, sintieron en carne propia el valor de las declaraciones N-S y la necesidad de implementarlas.
					
					  La implementacion de declaraciones intercoreanas es la unica salvacion de la nacion coreana y el remedio realista para el exito de dialogo y negociaciones.
					
					  Si las autoridades surcoreanas renuncian a su politica conflictiva y ejecutan sinceramente esos documentos aprobados entre ambas partes coreanas, resultaran fructiferos el dialogo y negociaciones y se lograran el mejoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena ambicion de agresion de reaccionarios japoneses
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena ambicion de agresion de reaccionarios japoneses
						
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ATCC) -- En estos dias, los reaccionarios japoneses debatieron el problema de estrechar la cooperacion militar con Estados Unidos subrayando la "necesidad" de fortalecer la "alianza para la seguridad" frente al "tiempo de emergencia" en la Peninsula Coreana y su contorno.
					  Entre tanto, como medida para acelerar el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles, el Ministerio de Defensa de Japon decidio trasladar dentro del ano en curso la comandancia de defensa de misiles a la base militar estadounidense en Yokoda y emplazar por primera vez en Okinawa el cohete de intercepcion desde la tierra.
					
					  Esas aventureras acciones militaristas amenazan severamente la paz y la seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					  Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 18 y prosigue:
					
					  Japon habla mucho de la "amenaza" de alguien para justificar sus maniobras expansionistas a ultramar.
					
					  La agresion a ultramar es la invariable ambicion y meta estrategica de Japon.
					
					  En el mismo contexto, los reaccionarios japoneses pretenden ahora estrechar la cooperacion militar con EE.UU. para reagredir no solo a Corea y China sino tambien a todo el continente asiatico.
					
					  Hoy, Japon ya no es "Estado pacifista".
					
					  Los reaccionarios japoneses deben ver correctamente la epoca de hoy que avanza hacia la paz y abandonar ahora mismo su anacronica intencion de retomar el camino de agresion que les llevara a la autodestruccion.

articles.title: Granjas cooperativas se preparan para la varada de este ano
articles.content:
Granjas cooperativas se preparan para la varada de este ano
Pyongyang, 18 de enero (ATCC) -- Marchan con adelanto en comparacion con el ano pasado en los preparativos para la varada de este ano gracias a los trabajadores agricolas movilizados para cumplir las tareas presentadas en el editorial conjunto del ano nuevo que definio la agricultura como cuestion vital para solucionar el problema de la vida del pueblo.
					  Las granjas cooperativas de la ciudad de Pyongyang, inclusive las de los municipios de Sun-an y Ryongsong, se esfuerzan mucho por elevar la fertilidad de la tierra cultivable para alcanzar las altas metas de produccion.
					
					  En la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, que asume gran parte de responsabilidad por el desarrollo agricola del pais, concentra las fuerzas en abonar las parcelas con fertilizantes organicos de buena calidad.
					
					  Pese a las condiciones meteorologicas desfavorables, en la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte transportan diariamente a las parcelas, segun el plan detallado, miles de toneladas de estiercol movilizando generalmente la mano de obra y los medios de transporte.
					
					  En las provincias de Phyong-an del Sur y del Norte, etc. aseguraron de antemano las semillas de buena variedad convenientes a las caracteristicas zonales y a las condiciones de suelo.
					
					  Ademas, aumentan la produccion de fertilizante Hukbosan y estiercol biologico activo.
					
					  De otro lado, en otras zonas rurales mantienen a perfeccion las maquinas y aperos agricolas para usarlos eficientemente en las faenas agricolas de este ano.
					
					  Entre tanto, las fabricas de piezas del tractor trabajan intensamente para proveer a las granjas de mayor cantidad de accesorios.
					
					  Los funcionarios del Consejo de Ministros, ministerios y organos centrales, las provincias, las ciudades y los distritos ayudan mucho al campo donando mucha cantidad de estiercol e implementos agricolas.
